Description:
Job Title: Manager of Sourcing and DevelopmentLocation: New York, NY 10012Duration: Permanent position
Important information from the HM:The role is open due to growth as they are moving away from third parties and bringing departments like Procurement in-house.This is a purchasing and procurement role with aspects of product design.Most of the products are from overseas factories and producers, so international procurement experience is key.Products are residential building materials and will be purchased by the thousands - sinks, tile, granite, showers, toilets, tubs, cabinets, carpeting, flooring, lighting fixtures, hardware, and other finishes.Travel could be up to 30% and mainly domestically with a possible overseas trip now and againLook for candidates from large Residential or Commercial construction companies or the Product Manufacturers themselves as ideal. 
Job Description:The Manager of Sourcing and Development is responsible for executing product development and efficient sourcing processes to deliver high-value construction finish products that will be installed in our homes. The Manager of Sourcing and Development will negotiate with suppliers to obtain goods, materials, and services at the best prices by using strategic sourcing strategies and extensive knowledge of the industry. Work with legal counsel to ensure that all contracts relating to product procurement contain all details of the negotiation. Ensure all Vendor Files and Product Data in the Web Enabled Product Information Management (PIM) Database are accurate.
To qualify,A bachelorâ€™s degree in administration, logistics, supply chain, or a related field is required. A minimum of 5 years of proven experience in sourcing processes from overseas and domestic suppliers, building relationships with manufacturers, buying agents, and inspection and testing services.Experience in a wide range of consumer products such as case goods, lighting, and plumbing finish items in a manufacturing, retail, or distribution environment is preferred. Strong negotiation skills. Sound time-management and organizational skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
